Why Hiring Freshers is a Smart InvestmentBringing freshers on board injects new energy, fresh viewpoints, and long-term growth potential into a company.Though they may not have hands-on experience, recent graduates offer a solid educational background, strong adaptability, and an eagerness to learn. They're often highly motivated to prove themselves and quickly embrace the company culture, contributing innovative ideas and a positive attitude.Hiring fresh talent allows organizations to train and develop employees according to their specific needs, creating a loyal and aligned workforce. They're often highly motivated to prove themselves and quickly embrace the company culture, contributing innovative ideas and a positive attitude.Hiring fresh talent allows organizations to train and develop employees according to their specific needs, creating a loyal and aligned workforce. Why Hiring Freshers is a Smart InvestmentBringing freshers on board injects new energy, fresh viewpoints, and long-term growth potential into a company.Though they may not have hands-on experience, recent graduates offer a solid educational background, strong adaptability, and an eagerness to learn. They're often highly motivated to prove themselves and quickly embrace the company culture, contributing innovative ideas and a positive attitude.Hiring fresh talent allows organizations to train and develop employees according to their specific needs, creating a loyal and aligned workforce. It also helps reduce recruitment costs over time, as freshers can grow within the company.Moreover, hiring freshers promotes diversity, builds a learning-focused environment, and helps businesses stay ahead by nurturing future-ready talent.Investing in freshers means investing in a thriving, sustainable future.hashtag#NowHiringhashtag#Freshers Welcomehashtag#Career Opportunitieshashtag#Remote Jobshashtag#FullTimeRoleshashtag#WorkFromHomehashtag#LinkedIn Talent

They're often highly motivated to prove themselves and quickly embrace the company culture, contributing innovative ideas and a positive attitude.Hiring fresh talent allows organizations to train and develop employees according to their specific needs, creating a loyal and aligned workforce. As an MIS Executive, you'll be responsible for managing and analyzing data, generating reports, and providing insights to support business decisions.Key Responsibilities:1. Why Hiring Freshers is a Smart InvestmentBringing freshers on board injects new energy, fresh viewpoints, and long-term growth potential into a company.Though they may not have hands-on experience, recent graduates offer a solid educational background, strong adaptability, and an eagerness to learn. They're often highly motivated to prove themselves and quickly embrace the company culture, contributing innovative ideas and a positive attitude.Hiring fresh talent allows organizations to train and develop employees according to their specific needs, creating a loyal and aligned workforce. As an MIS Executive, you'll be responsible for managing and analyzing data, generating reports, and providing insights to support business decisions.Key Responsibilities:1. 90% of candidates fail these 8 job interview questions. Here’s how to ACE them.”Most job seekers sabotage themselves by overcomplicating answers. Keep it simple, human, and strategic.Bonus Alert 🎁 💯 Learn Al in 3 minutes a day for FREE!Subscribe now and receive:50+ Al courses1000+ Advanced Prompts30+ ChatGPT Cheatsheets and more100% FREEhttps://lnkd.in/gzzyEsK9I’ve reviewed 500+ interview answers (and coached hires at Google and Microsoft). Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

90% of candidates fail these 8 job interview questions. Here’s how to ACE them.”Most job seekers sabotage themselves by overcomplicating answers. Keep it simple, human, and strategic.Bonus Alert 🎁 💯 Learn Al in 3 minutes a day for FREE!Subscribe now and receive:50+ Al courses1000+ Advanced Prompts30+ ChatGPT Cheatsheets and more100% FREEhttps://lnkd.in/gzzyEsK9I’ve reviewed 500+ interview answers (and coached hires at Google and Microsoft). Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

As an MIS Executive, you'll be responsible for managing and analyzing data, generating reports, and providing insights to support business decisions.Key Responsibilities:1. 90% of candidates fail these 8 job interview questions. Here’s how to ACE them.”Most job seekers sabotage themselves by overcomplicating answers. Keep it simple, human, and strategic.Bonus Alert 🎁 💯 Learn Al in 3 minutes a day for FREE!Subscribe now and receive:50+ Al courses1000+ Advanced Prompts30+ ChatGPT Cheatsheets and more100% FREEhttps://lnkd.in/gzzyEsK9I’ve reviewed 500+ interview answers (and coached hires at Google and Microsoft). Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

90% of candidates fail these 8 job interview questions. Here’s how to ACE them.”Most job seekers sabotage themselves by overcomplicating answers. Keep it simple, human, and strategic.Bonus Alert 🎁 💯 Learn Al in 3 minutes a day for FREE!Subscribe now and receive:50+ Al courses1000+ Advanced Prompts30+ ChatGPT Cheatsheets and more100% FREEhttps://lnkd.in/gzzyEsK9I’ve reviewed 500+ interview answers (and coached hires at Google and Microsoft). Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

💡 A Thought for the Hiring World: Let’s Re-Think How We Welcome Fresh TalentToday, I want to share a reflection not from a place of complaint, but from curiosity and care.Many companies proudly open doors for freshers or interns, which is amazing. But the process that follows often mirrors that of hiring for senior-level roles multiple rounds, high-pressure interviews, and scenario-based questions that assume years of experience.As someone who’s been through this recently, I found myself wondering:👉 Are we expecting too much, too soon, from those who are just starting out?Freshers are not meant to have it all figured out.They bring raw potential, eagerness to learn, and fresh perspectives and what they truly need is a space to grow, guided by mentorship.🧠 Instead of treating internship interviews as mini full-time job trials, what if we focused more on: •	Curiosity over perfection •	Willingness to learn over experience •	Adaptability over textbook answersBecause every confident professional we see today once started as a nervous fresher who just needed one company to believe in them.🎯 To every corporate or startup out there:If you’re hiring freshers, thank you.Now let’s also design processes that encourage, not overwhelm that build, not filter.This small shift can create a big difference in nurturing the next generation of talent.hashtag#FreshersWelcome hashtag#HiringMindset hashtag#CorporateCulture hashtag#EarlyCareer hashtag#TalentDevelopment hashtag#InternshipHiring hashtag#ThoughtLeadership hashtag#LearningCulture

90% of candidates fail these 8 job interview questions. Here’s how to ACE them.”Most job seekers sabotage themselves by overcomplicating answers. Keep it simple, human, and strategic.Bonus Alert 🎁 💯 Learn Al in 3 minutes a day for FREE!Subscribe now and receive:50+ Al courses1000+ Advanced Prompts30+ ChatGPT Cheatsheets and more100% FREEhttps://lnkd.in/gzzyEsK9I’ve reviewed 500+ interview answers (and coached hires at Google and Microsoft). Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

💡 A Thought for the Hiring World: Let’s Re-Think How We Welcome Fresh TalentToday, I want to share a reflection not from a place of complaint, but from curiosity and care.Many companies proudly open doors for freshers or interns, which is amazing. But the process that follows often mirrors that of hiring for senior-level roles multiple rounds, high-pressure interviews, and scenario-based questions that assume years of experience.As someone who’s been through this recently, I found myself wondering:👉 Are we expecting too much, too soon, from those who are just starting out?Freshers are not meant to have it all figured out.They bring raw potential, eagerness to learn, and fresh perspectives and what they truly need is a space to grow, guided by mentorship.🧠 Instead of treating internship interviews as mini full-time job trials, what if we focused more on: •	Curiosity over perfection •	Willingness to learn over experience •	Adaptability over textbook answersBecause every confident professional we see today once started as a nervous fresher who just needed one company to believe in them.🎯 To every corporate or startup out there:If you’re hiring freshers, thank you.Now let’s also design processes that encourage, not overwhelm that build, not filter.This small shift can create a big difference in nurturing the next generation of talent.hashtag#FreshersWelcome hashtag#HiringMindset hashtag#CorporateCulture hashtag#EarlyCareer hashtag#TalentDevelopment hashtag#InternshipHiring hashtag#ThoughtLeadership hashtag#LearningCulture

90% of candidates fail these 8 job interview questions. Here’s how to ACE them.”Most job seekers sabotage themselves by overcomplicating answers. Keep it simple, human, and strategic.Bonus Alert 🎁 💯 Learn Al in 3 minutes a day for FREE!Subscribe now and receive:50+ Al courses1000+ Advanced Prompts30+ ChatGPT Cheatsheets and more100% FREEhttps://lnkd.in/gzzyEsK9I’ve reviewed 500+ interview answers (and coached hires at Google and Microsoft). Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

💡 A Thought for the Hiring World: Let’s Re-Think How We Welcome Fresh TalentToday, I want to share a reflection not from a place of complaint, but from curiosity and care.Many companies proudly open doors for freshers or interns, which is amazing. But the process that follows often mirrors that of hiring for senior-level roles multiple rounds, high-pressure interviews, and scenario-based questions that assume years of experience.As someone who’s been through this recently, I found myself wondering:👉 Are we expecting too much, too soon, from those who are just starting out?Freshers are not meant to have it all figured out.They bring raw potential, eagerness to learn, and fresh perspectives and what they truly need is a space to grow, guided by mentorship.🧠 Instead of treating internship interviews as mini full-time job trials, what if we focused more on: •	Curiosity over perfection •	Willingness to learn over experience •	Adaptability over textbook answersBecause every confident professional we see today once started as a nervous fresher who just needed one company to believe in them.🎯 To every corporate or startup out there:If you’re hiring freshers, thank you.Now let’s also design processes that encourage, not overwhelm that build, not filter.This small shift can create a big difference in nurturing the next generation of talent.hashtag#FreshersWelcome hashtag#HiringMindset hashtag#CorporateCulture hashtag#EarlyCareer hashtag#TalentDevelopment hashtag#InternshipHiring hashtag#ThoughtLeadership hashtag#LearningCulture

“ʟᴇᴀʀɴ ᴛᴏ ᴜɴʟᴏᴠᴇ, ᴜɴʟᴏᴠᴇ ᴛᴏ ʟᴏᴠᴇ.”Sounds like 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘣𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘬, but it’s also how you enter your upgrade pro era.You unlove the old ways of thinking.Unlearn the noise.Unlove perfection to finally love progress.This photo is a throwback to my high school days, standing at an exhibition, running a stall for my NGO.I didn’t have a brand strategy, CTA, or a digital funnel.But I had belief.That raw clarity is what marketing still needs today no matter how evolved the tools get.Fast forward, I now run a digital marketing agency for startups Loop LaunchBecause I’ve unlearned what marketing used to be and learned to love what it’s becoming.It’s not about being everywhere.It’s about showing up with purpose, story, and strategy.The digital world? It’s ruthless.You either adapt or become background noise.What used to work last year barely holds attention today.That’s why your brand needs more than just content. It needs context.What I love most about digital marketing and what every brand should do is this:Speak with strategic authenticity.Forget the overdone trends.Be clear. Be intentional. And mean what you post.At Loop Launch, we don’t wait for things to be perfect.We build in chaos because we’ve learned to unlove the wait and love the doing.We create cost-effective, sharp strategies that help startups get seen where it matters most.This July, we’re welcoming new clients, opening fresh roles, and diving deep into disruption.Because the real stories? They never start polished.They start just like this picture : raw, real, and ready to evolve.If you’re a startup founder, a fresher, or someone ready to get hands-on experience and real client work this is your place. 90% of candidates fail these 8 job interview questions. Here’s how to ACE them.”Most job seekers sabotage themselves by overcomplicating answers. Keep it simple, human, and strategic.Bonus Alert 🎁 💯 Learn Al in 3 minutes a day for FREE!Subscribe now and receive:50+ Al courses1000+ Advanced Prompts30+ ChatGPT Cheatsheets and more100% FREEhttps://lnkd.in/gzzyEsK9I’ve reviewed 500+ interview answers (and coached hires at Google and Microsoft). Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

💡 A Thought for the Hiring World: Let’s Re-Think How We Welcome Fresh TalentToday, I want to share a reflection not from a place of complaint, but from curiosity and care.Many companies proudly open doors for freshers or interns, which is amazing. But the process that follows often mirrors that of hiring for senior-level roles multiple rounds, high-pressure interviews, and scenario-based questions that assume years of experience.As someone who’s been through this recently, I found myself wondering:👉 Are we expecting too much, too soon, from those who are just starting out?Freshers are not meant to have it all figured out.They bring raw potential, eagerness to learn, and fresh perspectives and what they truly need is a space to grow, guided by mentorship.🧠 Instead of treating internship interviews as mini full-time job trials, what if we focused more on: •	Curiosity over perfection •	Willingness to learn over experience •	Adaptability over textbook answersBecause every confident professional we see today once started as a nervous fresher who just needed one company to believe in them.🎯 To every corporate or startup out there:If you’re hiring freshers, thank you.Now let’s also design processes that encourage, not overwhelm that build, not filter.This small shift can create a big difference in nurturing the next generation of talent.hashtag#FreshersWelcome hashtag#HiringMindset hashtag#CorporateCulture hashtag#EarlyCareer hashtag#TalentDevelopment hashtag#InternshipHiring hashtag#ThoughtLeadership hashtag#LearningCulture

“ʟᴇᴀʀɴ ᴛᴏ ᴜɴʟᴏᴠᴇ, ᴜɴʟᴏᴠᴇ ᴛᴏ ʟᴏᴠᴇ.”Sounds like 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘣𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘬, but it’s also how you enter your upgrade pro era.You unlove the old ways of thinking.Unlearn the noise.Unlove perfection to finally love progress.This photo is a throwback to my high school days, standing at an exhibition, running a stall for my NGO.I didn’t have a brand strategy, CTA, or a digital funnel.But I had belief.That raw clarity is what marketing still needs today no matter how evolved the tools get.Fast forward, I now run a digital marketing agency for startups Loop LaunchBecause I’ve unlearned what marketing used to be and learned to love what it’s becoming.It’s not about being everywhere.It’s about showing up with purpose, story, and strategy.The digital world? It’s ruthless.You either adapt or become background noise.What used to work last year barely holds attention today.That’s why your brand needs more than just content. It needs context.What I love most about digital marketing and what every brand should do is this:Speak with strategic authenticity.Forget the overdone trends.Be clear. Be intentional. And mean what you post.At Loop Launch, we don’t wait for things to be perfect.We build in chaos because we’ve learned to unlove the wait and love the doing.We create cost-effective, sharp strategies that help startups get seen where it matters most.This July, we’re welcoming new clients, opening fresh roles, and diving deep into disruption.Because the real stories? They never start polished.They start just like this picture : raw, real, and ready to evolve.If you’re a startup founder, a fresher, or someone ready to get hands-on experience and real client work this is your place. Below: DOs, DON’Ts, and scripts to steal for your next interview.1️⃣ “Tell me about yourself.”DO:→ Start with your name + location.→ Education + experience in 1 sentence.→ End with ONE reason you’re qualified.Example:“Hi, I’m Alex from Mumbai. I have a BA in English and 2 years teaching kids. I thrive in chaos—ask my 35-student Zoom classes!”DON’T:🗑️ “I was born in 1999…”🗑️ “I love long walks on the beach…”Pro Tip: Talk like a human, not a resume.2️⃣ “Why should I hire you?”DO:→ Skills + work ethic → company’s needs.→ Add specific examples (even as a fresher).Example:“I’m a fast learner—last month, I mastered Python basics in 72 hours to automate my team’s reports.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m the best candidate.”🗑️ “You’ll regret not hiring me.”3️⃣ “What’s your weakness?”DO:→ Pick real but fixable flaws.→ Show progress.Example:“I struggle to say ‘no,’ which sometimes overloads me. Now, I block ‘focus hours’ daily.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m a perfectionist.”🗑️ “I have no weaknesses.”4️⃣ “What are your strengths?”DO:→ Align with the job description.→ Use actionable traits (punctuality, adaptability).Example:“I’m self-motivated—during lockdowns, I designed a virtual workshop that boosted student retention by 40%.”DON’T:🗑️ “I’m great at everything.”5️⃣ “Why are you leaving your job?”DO:→ Thank past employer + focus on growth.Example:“I’m grateful for my team, but I’m ready to tackle larger-scale projects in EdTech.”DON’T:🗑️ “My boss was toxic.”6️⃣ “Salary expectations?”DO (Freshers):→ “I prioritize learning. I trust your company’s standards.”DO (Experienced):→ “Based on my research, ₹X-₹Y aligns with this role’s scope.”Follow TheInfinder for more ...

💡 A Thought for the Hiring World: Let’s Re-Think How We Welcome Fresh TalentToday, I want to share a reflection not from a place of complaint, but from curiosity and care.Many companies proudly open doors for freshers or interns, which is amazing. But the process that follows often mirrors that of hiring for senior-level roles multiple rounds, high-pressure interviews, and scenario-based questions that assume years of experience.As someone who’s been through this recently, I found myself wondering:👉 Are we expecting too much, too soon, from those who are just starting out?Freshers are not meant to have it all figured out.They bring raw potential, eagerness to learn, and fresh perspectives and what they truly need is a space to grow, guided by mentorship.🧠 Instead of treating internship interviews as mini full-time job trials, what if we focused more on: •	Curiosity over perfection •	Willingness to learn over experience •	Adaptability over textbook answersBecause every confident professional we see today once started as a nervous fresher who just needed one company to believe in them.🎯 To every corporate or startup out there:If you’re hiring freshers, thank you.Now let’s also design processes that encourage, not overwhelm that build, not filter.This small shift can create a big difference in nurturing the next generation of talent.hashtag#FreshersWelcome hashtag#HiringMindset hashtag#CorporateCulture hashtag#EarlyCareer hashtag#TalentDevelopment hashtag#InternshipHiring hashtag#ThoughtLeadership hashtag#LearningCulture

“ʟᴇᴀʀɴ ᴛᴏ ᴜɴʟᴏᴠᴇ, ᴜɴʟᴏᴠᴇ ᴛᴏ ʟᴏᴠᴇ.”Sounds like 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘣𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘬, but it’s also how you enter your upgrade pro era.You unlove the old ways of thinking.Unlearn the noise.Unlove perfection to finally love progress.This photo is a throwback to my high school days, standing at an exhibition, running a stall for my NGO.I didn’t have a brand strategy, CTA, or a digital funnel.But I had belief.That raw clarity is what marketing still needs today no matter how evolved the tools get.Fast forward, I now run a digital marketing agency for startups Loop LaunchBecause I’ve unlearned what marketing used to be and learned to love what it’s becoming.It’s not about being everywhere.It’s about showing up with purpose, story, and strategy.The digital world? It’s ruthless.You either adapt or become background noise.What used to work last year barely holds attention today.That’s why your brand needs more than just content. It needs context.What I love most about digital marketing and what every brand should do is this:Speak with strategic authenticity.Forget the overdone trends.Be clear. Be intentional. And mean what you post.At Loop Launch, we don’t wait for things to be perfect.We build in chaos because we’ve learned to unlove the wait and love the doing.We create cost-effective, sharp strategies that help startups get seen where it matters most.This July, we’re welcoming new clients, opening fresh roles, and diving deep into disruption.Because the real stories? They never start polished.They start just like this picture : raw, real, and ready to evolve.If you’re a startup founder, a fresher, or someone ready to get hands-on experience and real client work this is your place.
